title: In Trump’s Second Term, Far-Right Agenda Enters the Mainstream
summary: President Trump has embraced an array of far-right views and talking points in ways that have delighted many right-wing activists who have long supported those ideas.

title: A Muted Homecoming for Kilmar Abrego Garcia
summary: Mr. Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully deported to El Salvador, is keeping a low profile as his lawyers prepare to fight the Trump administration’s proposal to deport him to Uganda.

title: Fed Officials Try to Keep Focus on Economy as Trump Intensifies Attacks
summary: The administration’s effort to oust a Fed governor as part of a pressure campaign for lower borrowing costs created an inescapable distraction at this year’s Jackson Hole conference.

title: Intel's Downfall Underlines How Even Tech Giants Can Fade
summary: The Silicon Valley chipmaker’s journey from icon to a government project, with the sale of a 10 percent stake to the Trump administration, underlines how even the mightiest in tech can fall.

title: After Gaza Famine Report, U.S. Is Mostly Silent and Israel Defiant
summary: The White House has not commented on a report finding famine in Gaza. Analysts say that absent U.S. pressure, Israel is unlikely to change course.

title: Justice Dept. Sent Congress Epstein Files That Were Already Public, Democrats Say
summary: The ‘overwhelming majority’ of the material provided to a key investigative committee in response to a subpoena had already been released, according to Democratic members.

title: 5 Takeaways From Ghislaine Maxwell’s Interview About Jeffrey Epstein
summary: In a courthouse interview with the deputy attorney general, Ms. Maxwell, who has been convicted of sex trafficking, maintained that President Trump and other famous figures were not involved.

title: Can Redesigns of Wagner Park and East River Park Save Lower Manhattan?
summary: Two new parks fortifying the city’s coastline survived a bureaucratic gantlet that reveals why progress so often feels stuck.

title: The ‘Lioness’ at the Center of a City Hall Battered by Scandal
summary: Before Ingrid Lewis-Martin was indicted on bribery charges, she was one of the most powerful people in Mayor Eric Adams’s orbit. Now she may hasten his fall in New York.

title: New York Is a Big City. Its Graft Has Become Small-Town Stuff.
summary: The city’s corruption once had ambition to match its soaring skyscrapers. Indictments this week described cut-rate schemes with far lower returns — and there was that cash in a potato-chip bag.

title: The Menendez Brothers’ Momentum Built for Years. It Was Dashed in 2 Days.
summary: Young people energized a push for redemption — and the release of Lyle and Erik. Parole commissioners took a different view and a harder line.

title: Where U.S. Medicines Are Made and How Trump’s Tariffs Could Affect Them
summary: President Trump’s planned pharmaceutical tariffs threaten to hit many of the most common and well-known drugs that Americans take.

title: Faced With Trump’s English Mandate, Mexico’s Truckers Report to Class
summary: Companies, fearing penalties that could put them out of business, race to make sure their drivers have enough English to communicate with U.S. officials.

title: At Lady Gaga’s Mayhem Ball, a Pop Star Is Reborn
summary: The singer and songwriter proved she’s operating at the peak of her powers during a two-and-a-half-hour set that drew sharp connections between her past and present.

title: Texas Legislature Gives Final Approval to Redistricting Map Favoring Republicans
summary: The map’s passage was a major victory in President Trump’s push to get Republican state leaders to help his party keep control of the U.S. House.

title: How Redistricting Wars Could Give the G.O.P. Up to 7 Seats
summary: As a handful of states have made moves and begun discussing redrawing their maps, here’s what’s at stake.

title: The White House Wants Indiana to Redistrict. Republicans There Are Split.
summary: As President Trump asks Republican-led states to redraw congressional maps, some Indiana conservatives are pushing back. “They should leave it alone,” one legislator said.

title: Green Funerals Are Becoming a Popular Choice for Environmentally Conscious Americans
summary: More Americans are choosing burials in which everything is biodegradable.

title: We Can Disagree on Trump’s Motives. But a Pattern Is Still Emerging.
summary: Just how can we tell which of Trump’s moves matters?

title: Would You Believe This Spy’s Name?
summary: Spy fiction thrives on vermismilitude — shy are so many writers so incompetent when it comes to naming foriegn characters?

title: Florida Paints Over Rainbow Memorial for Pulse Nightclub Shooting Victims
summary: The mayor of Orlando, Fla., said that the crosswalk mural, which featured the Pride flag’s colors, was removed overnight this week. Community members protested and have, for now, repainted it.

title: Police Release Names of 5 Killed in Tour Bus Crash Near Buffalo
summary: Those killed in the accident on Friday ranged in age from 22 to 65 and included three people from New Jersey, a Chinese student at Columbia University and a person from India.

title: Flat Fire in Oregon Doubles in 24 Hours to More Than 18,000 Acres
summary: More than 1,000 homes in Oregon were under some kind of evacuation because of the Flat fire, which was one of many wildfires burning in the West, amid hot weather.

title: The All-Female Hacker House Trying to Break A.I.’s Glass Ceiling
summary: FoundHer House, a home in San Francisco’s Glen Park neighborhood, is the rare all-female hacker house where residents are creating a supportive community to build their start-ups.
